com.yantra.api.ycp.interop

Interface executeXReferenceTransform

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCPApi, YIFApi

    public interface executeXReferenceTransform

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document executeXReferenceTransform(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inDoc)
      The executeXReferenceTransform API performs cross reference transformation on the xml attributes of input document.

    • Method Detail

      • executeXReferenceTransform

        org.w3c.dom.Document executeXReferenceTransform(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                org.w3c.dom.Document inDoc)
                                         throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                java.rmi.RemoteException

        The executeXReferenceTransform API performs cross reference transformation on the xml attributes of input document. Typically the input document is any exposed API input/output xml. It has a node XrefData at root level with XmlName as the attribute, which is used to get the names of From System, From Organization, To System and To Organization, between which the data transformation is done.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        Validations:

        Input document root node should contain a node XrefData with XmlName as the attribute.

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: In the configurator under Platform, Configuring Nomenclature Components, the following components need to be configured before executing this API

        • Nomenclature Codes: Allows you to define attributes eligible for transformation.
        • Nomenclature Definition: Allows you to define entities and their values as seen by each interacting system or trading partner and the mapping between external systems and trading partners.
        • Nomenclature Configuration: Allows you to define the rules to be applied and the entities that need to be transformed when data is exchanged between Sterling applications and external systems or trading partners. The configuration is captured for each document exchanged.

        Please refer to Configuring Nomenclature Components Section of Platform Configuration Guide for more information.

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inDoc - Contains details about the input document.

        Returns:
        Document.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
